Negative Reviews:
Parking Fee and what essentially having to opt for the Valet.  I think paying guests should not have to pay for parking.  I didn‚Äôt know where the parking garage was and felt forced into using the Valet who kept moving my seat when driving my car.  That was irritating. Once I realized where the garage was, I had already used the Valet and as I was there only 1 night, I paid it. 

The elevator on my side of the building was not working and I had to walk a marathon to get to an elevator.  I am disabled so that was not convenient at all. 

There is no microwave in the rooms.  Bizarre.  No courtesy coffee for guests unless you count the crappy 2-cup coffee maker in the room which is never, ever decent coffee. 

Before ever getting there, I called the hotel to advise I was traveling with young teens and that I needed us to be together and when I got there, our rooms were in different places around the floor.  On arrival, I told the Clerk we needed our rooms together and she kindly provided them but, as I said, on the side of the hotel the farthest from the elevator.

Review Title: Great location, clean hotel...but a few hiccups
Negative Reviews:
When we got there, parking was full at the facility. We had to park across the street in a public parking lot (which turned out to be cheaper and convenient...so, a happy accident!). We never tried to park at the facility after that. 
When we tried to eat at the buffet for breakfast or in one of the on-site restaurants, they were always closed. On a Monday morning, nothing was open but the ala carte area which was not ideal. They had premade breakfast sandwiches, muffins, etc...but not very palatable and no fresh fruit. We were very disappointed with this aspect of our stay as we asked at the front desk the night before if the restaurant was open the next morning and were told 'yes'. We did go to the Metro Diner and Bar a couple of blocks from the hotel for dinner and breakfast. We highly recommend this place as an alternative.

We booked two doubles, ended up with a Queen, this was not comfortable.

Hotel is close to the downtown, maybe a five to ten minute walk. But keep in mind that 50 to 60 percent of the shops are vacant.

The room was booked well in advance and the room was available, they simply gave it to someone else.

Negative Reviews:
I like that they use liquid soap in the shower, as well as having dispensers for shampoo and conditioner, but the liquid soap was empty. That's a little nitpicky but the staff needs to keep up on that. This is the second time I've had an empty soap dispenser in a hotel shower. 
Also, there's a very noisy club across the street but I didn't hear it from my room.
Positive Reviews: Great location in downtown Atlanta. The Marta station is two and a half blocks away but two of those blocks are uphill. The rooms are nice. I loved that there's a Starbucks on the third floor though it closes around 6 PM. There's a pool, bar, restaurant, gift shop, and the staff is very friendly. They let me check in a couple hours early which helped me out greatly. The view was nice. The rooms are good, the beds are comfy, the pillows are fine/adequate, and you get plenty of towels. The WiFi is fast. The TV has lots of channels. I think it should be noted that they have the fastest elevators of any hotel I've ever stayed in. They get points for that.

Review Title: Had a great stay, easy check in
Positive Reviews: convenience of bar and restaurant

The Sheraton is quite expensive at approx $400 per night, but that seems to be the "going rate" in central Atlanta.  The decor is a bit tired however the room was comfortable: very good bed; excellent shower and lovely products in bathroom.  The pool and pool area was really nice and very warm so despite, winter, lovely to relax in.  Breakfast was good.  Service very good.  We arrived early in morning and got a room straightaway.  We also got a check out at 2pm on our final day so on the whole we were pleased.  Location was great with easy access to train station and good restaurants close by.

Review Title: Overall our experience at the hotel was sad because the homeless population is out of control.
Negative Reviews: I am saddened and alarmed at the homeless situation near this hotel.  My husband and I were approached multiple times on the street as we walked to Wahlburgers minutes from this hotel.  Then when we returned to the Sheraton, we pressed the elevator and a man was sitting inside on the floor naked covered by a paper. He was speaking incoherently and I was shocked.  Immediately we tried the second elevator but it was being held up on the 12th floor so we made the decision to report the situation to the front desk, but a staff member met us on the way.  Together, we went back to the elevators and the Sheraton staff member pressed the elevator button and informed us that another guest reported the man in the elevator.  The staff member promptly apologized for our distress and she requested security to come and remove the man from the elevator.  As security arrived he also apologized for this sad turn of events.
Positive Reviews: Check-in was a breeze, even though I used a third party, they were quickly able to locate the reservation.  The room was clean and excellent.  The hot water was very hot.  The air conditioner was working at a nice comfortable level all night not humming or rattling as I have experienced in the past with other hotels.  We received extra towels as soon as we requested them.  The staff was friendly and very accomodating.  When our Uber driver arrived, the Sheraton staff helped me in and out of the vehicle and wished us a well.  Overall, I enjoyed my stay and it is a beautiful hotel.

Negative Reviews: Service however was very poor, the manager yelled at one of us for trying to inform him that the restaurant he sent us to at the hotel was closing and was not serving anyone else as he was trying to tell the next guest to go to it as well. No drinks in any drink machine, no waters available. We ordered a pizza and room service refused to bring it to the room stated we had to come down to get it. They had a store on site with drinks and food and had everything closed and no one was able to get anything with out having to walk a block down the street to the nearest thing open. It was raining hard might I add and velvet parking was full also. To mention a few things.

Review Title: Worth staying for the swimming pool. 20 minute walk to Olympic Park.

Positive Reviews: The hotel is downtown, about 15 minutes walking from the Olympic Park and rhe World of CocaCola. It was clean and the bed relatively comfortable. There are vending machines and ice machines on each floor and The Market/Starbucks on the 3rd floor with a selection of sandwiches, salads, drinks and coffee, and a snack and souvenir shop in the ground floor. The breakfast is paid apart ($17 for fruit and bread/bagels with the option of strawberry philadelphia, butter or strawberry jam, or a full buffet for $21, which is all the previous plus watery scrambled eggs or equally watery omelette, burger patties, bacon, potato and oatmeal/porridge). Review Title: Had a great stay, easy check in
Positive Reviews: convenience of bar and restaurant

The Sheraton is quite expensive at approx $400 per night, but that seems to be the "going rate" in central Atlanta.  The decor is a bit tired however the room was comfortable: very good bed; excellent shower and lovely products in bathroom.  The pool and pool area was really nice and very warm so despite, winter, lovely to relax in.  Breakfast was good.  Service very good.  We arrived early in morning and got a room straightaway.  We also got a check out at 2pm on our final day so on the whole we were pleased.  Location was great with easy access to train station and good restaurants close by.

Review Title: Overall our experience at the hotel was sad because the homeless population is out of control.
Negative Reviews: I am saddened and alarmed at the homeless situation near this hotel.  My husband and I were approached multiple times on the street as we walked to Wahlburgers minutes from this hotel.  Then when we returned to the Sheraton, we pressed the elevator and a man was sitting inside on the floor naked covered by a paper. He was speaking incoherently and I was shocked.  Immediately we tried the second elevator but it was being held up on the 12th floor so we made the decision to report the situation to the front desk, but a staff member met us on the way.  Together, we went back to the elevators and the Sheraton staff member pressed the elevator button and informed us that another guest reported the man in the elevator.  The staff member promptly apologized for our distress and she requested security to come and remove the man from the elevator.  As security arrived he also apologized for this sad turn of events.
Positive Reviews: Check-in was a breeze, even though I used a third party, they were quickly able to locate the reservation.  The room was clean and excellent.  The hot water was very hot.  The air conditioner was working at a nice comfortable level all night not humming or rattling as I have experienced in the past with other hotels.  We received extra towels as soon as we requested them.  The staff was friendly and very accomodating.  When our Uber driver arrived, the Sheraton staff helped me in and out of the vehicle and wished us a well.  Overall, I enjoyed my stay and it is a beautiful hotel.

Review Title: Two fire alarms and no apology
Negative Reviews:
I arrived late at night from a road trip, so definitely looked tired and the lady in front treated me like I could not afford staying in the hotel. Definitely did not feel welcomed at all. 
Then there were two fire alarms during our stay. One 4.30 AM and one 9PM. After standing outside for half an hour during the middle of the night, people from the valet told us it was false alarm, we could go back in. No word from the hotel! For the second alarm we directly went to the reception and then lady said: i didn't hear any alarm. All alarm lights were flashing!! So she said she is going to investigate while looking at all of us at if we were crazy. Then she an announcement that it was a false alarm and we should go back to our rooms. No apology at all for that!!

Review Title: All and all, I would go elsewhere.  I‚Äôve gotten better service from Motel 6.
Negative Reviews:
CONS:
-	Leaves doors unlocked/ajar
-	Enjoys abusing guest credit cards
-	Ignores special requests
-	Does not follow up on issues
-	$45 valet parking or $35 self parking
-	No ‚Äúfree‚Äù breakfast unless you use $10 or less of the voucher given
-	Did not see any USB charging ports
-	Extra charging power strip UNDER side table
-	Super long and slow valet/parking lines
-	Super long and slow check in
-	In Downtown ATL so has everything that goes along with big city downtowns
-	Rooms anything but soundproof

Long, slow valet & self park lines. I get inside the hotel and there is another really long slow line.   To top it off, the staff is also taking an unusually long time checking in each guest. 

There is much cheaper parking ($25/night or $15 depending on check in/out time) a block or two down on the same side of the street.

Finally checked in, I get up to my room.  Not only is it RIGHT NEXT TO an Elevator, the stairs AND the Ice Machine (all of which I requested my room be away from and that they agreed to) but the door is not even locked.  In fact, it is ajar and the cord to the phone missing. I‚Äôm told they will get right on that‚Ä¶.and  I never hear back from them again before I check out the next morning.  I could hear drag racing from outside, people talking (regular level) in the halls and the elevator all night long.

As of this morning, this $112 stay has cost me $536 in holds on my credit card, including charges a full day after my check out with no explanation.  They don‚Äôt know my life.  What if I didn‚Äôt have that to spare?

UPDATE:  Despite their reply here, they have to date never responded as to why they charged an extra night's stay after I had already checked out.  I DID hear back from Corporate (who I also contacted) who gave me enough Wyndham points for a free night's stay.

-	I wasn‚Äôt strangled with a phone cord in my sleep
-	Comfy bed
-	Multiple softness of pillow

Negative Reviews: At check in they asked for my credit card and in addition to the total cost of the stay they charged 100 dollars which they said would be refunded at checkout if there was no damage or consumption, which I already knew when booking the hotel but I consider it an unpleasant policy. At checkout, receptionist PIERRA said everything was fine but after I left, she made an unauthorized charge of 145 dollars on my card. I only realized when I was at the airport what caused me the expense and inconvenience of returning to the hotel to demand the cancellation of the undue charge, which was treated in an indifferent and unprepared manner by receptionist PIERRA. I showed the double charge on my card and she insisted that there was no mistake on the part of the hotel and refused to call the manager, stopping answering my questions completely without the minimum level of politeness to serve guests. I left, contacted the hotel and opened a complaint with booking, but in addition to not receiving a response from the hotel, on the same day I identified new charges on my card from the hotel, which is unacceptable and made me have to block the card. I TRAVEL ALL OVER THE WORLD AND I HAVE NEVER HAD A PROBLEMS REGARDING THE UNAUTHORIZED USE OF MY CARD, MUCH LESS SEEN THE LACK OF EDUCATION AND UNPREPAREMENT OF THE RECEPTIONIST PIERRA IN IGNORING THE GUEST'S QUESTIONS. If you don't want to have problems with your card being used inappropriately, avoid this hotel because after 3 days they still haven't responded to me. To preserve their reputation they should treat guests better and this employee PIERRA should be fired

2) the first room they put me in was wet with humidity from the pool outside the balcony, one floor down.  It also smelled of chlorine and was filthy.
3) The new room was odor free but had stains on the carpet and furniture, mildew build-up in the corners in the bathroom.
4) the halls have terribly stained carpet. 
5) they give a coupon for $10 off meals at their restaurants.  I does not specifically say that it must be redeemed with the purchase of the meal.  It says it must be applied prior to checkout, so I presented it at the front desk before I checked out and they would not apply it to my charges, telling me i had to redeem it at the restaurant with posted my charges to the bill at checkout.  (clearly not a separate entity)
6) a dog barked 1/2 the night from my original room which I was told should not even be in service due to the poor condition.
The entire hotel is in dire need of updating, yet they price it as if it were a much better hotel.  When I asked about it, the staff told me the hotel had been a converted Sheraton and was scheduled for rehab.

My recent stay at this hotel was extremely disappointing. Parking was nonexistent, and the only option was a $45 valet service that was unorganized and slower than a crock pot. The AC went out on the first night of our stay, and while they offered to refund us and book another hotel last minute, this was hardly a convenient solution for out-of-town guests.

To make matters worse, the main water pipe burst, causing chaos for businesses in the downtown area. The hotel did not inform us of this issue until later that night. Had we known earlier, we would not have checked in and settled. My wife and I were left with no choice but to order food from distant restaurants since the hotel‚Äôs restaurants were closed. They also gave us vouchers for food and drinks that we couldn't use.

In a futile attempt to make amends, they promised us two bottles of water, which never arrived despite several requests. Upon checking out, we were still charged for the entire stay, and no charges were waived. Instead, we were handed a sticky note with the manager's email because he was allegedly avoiding guests all weekend.

Overall, this was the worst stay ever, and we will never return.

Review Title: Just okay and not worth the price.
Negative Reviews:
The rooms AC was awful. We had it all the way down on 60 degrees and would still just sweat from sitting there. We ended up not sleeping with any blankets on us because of how hot it was. 

The bed itself was ok but not the best. It was on the harder side so we‚Äôd wake up kind of stiff. Pillows were nice at first but would go flat quick. 

Everything seemed clean although there were little hairs stuck all over the bathroom ceiling. We assumed maybe it was from a previous guest shaving? 

I think the pictures of the hotel is a little misleading. It‚Äôs very dated on the inside and is heavily deodorized with this old lady smelling perfume? I‚Äôm not sensitive to smells but I could see someone who is hating it. One thing that really annoyed us was there‚Äôs no vending machines on any of the floors and the little shop inside closes at like 10 or 11. So coming back late, you‚Äôre out of luck if you want a drink or snack. 

I would say the room was worth the initial price but once they added on the daily $45 valet charge, $25 destination fee, and $5.00 state hotel fee, plus the sales tax of 8.9% and occupancy tax of 8%, I definitely don‚Äôt think the room was worth $900 for 4 nights. I‚Äôve stayed in 2 star hotels that were way nicer for half the price.

Review Title: I/We will NEVER stay at this hotel or recommend anyone to stay at this hotel.
Negative Reviews: The amount paid to stay for 3 nights was outragous due to all the issues we had to deal with. We were not told until arrival that we would either have to pay $45 a night for valet parking or find a parking lot somewhere around the block to park and walk, being two younger females that was a safety issue. On our second night there it rained and there was a line of vehicles trying to park or go through the valet area so we ended up waiting atleast 45 minutes and still had 4 vehicles infront of us so we ended up having to get out in the rain and walk from where we were parked. What is the point in paying valet if you have to wait that long to park and then still have to walk in the rain?  Our room stayed warm the entire time, we had the ac on the coolest setting and still it was not cool at all. Severely outdated. The door barely shut, it wiggled around alot, the deadbolt did not work either. The worst issue of all is that we were there on business and had to be up every morning at 7am yet we were not able to sleep due to people yelling and partying all night every single night (seemed to be coming from the courtyard). Quiet times were not enforced at all. I called down to the front desk multiple times before actually speaking with someone who said they would take care of it and they never did.  On saturday night it got so bad that after I called several times and was told that the security guard was going to take care of it I actually went down to the front desk in person and was told the same thing, (3 am in the morning). Smaller issues- the housekeeper came by and we told her we didnt want her to come clean until we left yet we came back from our conference and she had come in there and made up one bed and I'm not sure what else. The pool was closed on friday evening when we got back and on saturday. Breakfast was not included and was expensive. We paid $40 for 2 muffins, 2 sodas, and 2 frappes.

Negative Reviews: Did not like that breakfast was not included and how the parking garage was full so quickly but I had a early checkout with a half marathon in the morning. Positive Reviews: The room was very clean albeit the AC duct vent was unscrewed for the wall. My boyfriend joked that someone was hiding drugs or money in it (a la No Country For Old Men lol). Pool area was great and fun for both adults and kids. The bar staff was lovely and gave excellent conversation. Bonus was that my request for sanitary napkins at check-in were met. I'd definitely consider staying again.

Negative Reviews:
Shew, where to begin.  I'd start with, never ever stay here under any circumstances.  I'd rather sleep in my car.  But keep reading, it bets much much better.  The hotel itself is trapped in 2001, the WHOLE design and decore is so outdated it's laughable.   Brown is the main theme and color.

So let's get to the popular topic, parking.  In my 40 years I have NEVER stayed at a hotel that does not provide parking.  I don't mean the valet that's offered for 45 a day.  I mean ANY parking in general, ALL that is available and offered is their valet, for 45 a day.... If you want to use valet, they tell you there is a lot across the street that isn't operated by the hotel.  There's a sign that says 18 to park, now that's a TOTAL lie.  I parked my car just past midnight, left out the next morning around 10am, 22 dollars.  Parked there for 10 hours, 22 dollars.... Oh it gets better.  They also inform that there's a huge homeless problem and they like to stay inside the parking deck, so don't leave anything inside because your car might get broken into....that's not all!  They like to use the stairs as a TOILET.  The smell of urine and poop, really nice. So to avoid the stairs we will attempt the elevator, it doesn't work, which was probably a gift from God.  I can only imagine how terrible the inside of the elevator would be.

As I am writing this I find a nice big brown mystery stain on my comforter the hotel provides (pic included, praise Jesus we leave in the morning).  Went to warm up some food we had leftover from supper, oh there's not a microwave.  The 11th floor hallways has this odor of cologne stored in a colostomy bag.   The remote to the TV works when it wants to, but that's ok because you can download an app that you can use your phone as a remote, but good luck finding one that works with the TV.

This place is amateur hour at best and pathetic at worst.

Review Title: Great value for money; where the little details and lovely customer care made the stay delightful
Negative Reviews: I don't have many dislikes besides the fact that there wasn't much of a view (or their was but it wasn't great) which isn't a deal breaker and in some regard the hotel design felt a little dated
Positive Reviews:
10/10 for the customer care and awareness! The original room I booked wasn't ready when I arrived so I called reception and they gave me a different room immediately and with such pleasantries that you would definitely want after a long trip. Linda at the front desk was very helpful and genuine, it made me a whole lot more comfortable when you get service with a smile and conversation that makes it easy to ask if you needed anything. 

I absolutely loved the food (especially the cornbread which the chef makes fresh) from the restaurant. The service was spectacular, and Patricia at the bar was a delight, so down to earth and smiley. 

The bed was super comfy, and there were more than enough towels and basic toiletries provided. Although I didn't bring my swimsuit to take a dip, the pool area was a lovely hang out

The location was great too! Even though a lot of people drive or have access to a car in Atlanta, I feel there were some great food places, attractions and transport all within walking distance- and very helpful that without traffic the airport is literally 15-20minutes away

Absolutely felt Southern Hospitality here

Review Title: BUSINESS / CONFERENCE TRAVELERS - AVOID!!! They have refused to give me a receipt for months now.
Negative Reviews:
The primary issue I experienced was a lack of any service/follow-up after checking out, as many other reviewers have mentioned. I had zero issues with checking in or paying my bill - the Courtland Grand was more than happy to take my money (over $600, as I stayed several nights for the APHA conference). I paid for the hotel using my personal credit card, as I do not have access to a corporate card. 

I used the contactless checkout system (dropped my key into the dropbox), as I was in a hurry on the last morning of the conference to get to my session and catch my flight home. I assumed (incorrectly) that I would receive some sort of confirmation afterwards that I had checked out and that my account was settled - especially since the hotel had charged several additional fees and a damage deposit hold to my credit card. However, I never received anything like that from the Courtland Grand.

Fast forward three months, and I am still waiting for the hotel to issue me a receipt. I have called the Billing Department and left numerous messages. I called the front desk, and they told me no one was available to help me. I was given an email address for the Reservations Department, which I have contacted multiple times. I have yet to receive any response. Subsequent attempts to contact the front desk / main hotel line have gone unanswered, or the phone just rings and then goes back to the main menu options. It's honestly ridiculous at this point, and I have resorted to posting this review and filing a BBB complaint, because I have no way of receiving reimbursement from my employer without the receipt.
Positive Reviews: I actually enjoyed staying here - yes, the rooms are pretty outdated, but it was clean enough for me, and the indoor pool was great (stayed in November 2023).

Review Title: DOUBLE CHARGED‚Äî DO NOT STAY HERE
Negative Reviews: They double charged our card and so this weekend cost us much more than anticipated. When I called the hotel, after being transferred several times to a voicemail, I was finally able to speak to someone who was completely unhelpful. We used a third party company to book and used a personal card to hold. When we arrived, we requested to change the card so we could run the business card (as we do every single weekend we travel and have done for years‚Äî even previously at this hotel!) I watched my boss hand them her card, run it, and it say approved. Now my personal card was also charged! They‚Äôve offered no help and stated it was due to the third party provider and I‚Äôd have to contact them‚Ä¶ then why was the business card run on YOUR atm by YOUR staff and said approved? We normally come annually and we will not be staying here again.

Hotel is extremely dated and the furniture looks tired. The building looks like an auto shop or something - just not very inviting or cared for. Value - the hotel charges a 'resort' fee, which I think is just a huge scam that hotels have come up with. No one also ever mentions this to you - there is simply a sign at check in that I assume the hotel apparently has to put there, but no one ever says a word about it. In the end, you are simply presented with the bill. The hotel also sends an email before check in letting you know that due to covid, the rooms are not cleaned during the first three nights of your stay. Lastly - everything in the room for daily use is single-use plastic. The cups in the bathroom, coffee cups, the things you need for the coffee maker - everything plastic. Why not put real glasses in the room, coffee mugs, and coffee machines that do not produce so much plastic trash? And another point - the hotel seems understaffed. There was a huge check out line at 8 am in the morning, and only one person on duty.

Review Title: Be clear as to what you're getting
Negative Reviews:
A very big hotel with very few staff.  Feels a bit like a ghost town walking around.  Unresponsive to phone calls to Guest Services so had to go down to Reception twice to enquire how to get the TV to work properly and to request more tea and coffee sachets.  This morning I requested an extra blanket  - which never appeared.  Again  I hiked down to Reception to ask if my room should have been serviced (it wasn't) and was told that it is only done every 3rd day! 
Was on 7th floor and there seemed to be little sound insulation against noise from the street. 
Was surprised to be charged an additional $24+ per day for,I think,'Discretionary Services'. I have no idea what this charge was for and had not known previously that this charge would be made. I am left with the feeling that this hotel just want your money with little care for customer care. A real low on which to end probably my only trip to the US.  All my other stops in this country have been great. Can't wait to get on my flight home tomorrow.

They said they do it every 3 days but then sent me a message saying to pick my requests, of which one of the options was 'free room cleaning' and then I got a message the next day saying request denied (so why send it?) They alao really want you out of there - on the last day I had a wake up call I did not request at 6am and then a text asking when I was checking out. I chose 12pm which is the standard, but someone then came to my room asking when I was checking out at 10am. Not really sure what the motivation is behind sending you all these texts they have no intention of following.

Positive Reviews: We truly enjoyed every aspect of our stay at Sheraton Atlanta. Our experience started with a smooth and accommodating check-in. Nang greeted us very warmly and we were granted the ability to check-in early, which was absolutely fantastic! When we arrived at our room it was clean and fresh feeling. We loved the robe and sleepers in the bathroom, which was another nice touch. We enjoyed a hot and delicious breakfast each morning from the restaurant on site and were able to hit the gym afterwards, which had nice updated equipment with weights for my boyfriend and cardio for me. The pool area was nice with lots of lounging areas to just lay back and chillout. Some evenings we just set out there and enjoyed the area. We also discovered that the hotel is just two blocks from the MARTA (subway transit system) and a short walk to many points of interest like the Martin Luther King Center, and the Atlanta Aquarium. I really had a nice time and will be staying here again the next time that I return to Atlanta.

Review Title: Enjoyed everything, and will be back
Negative Reviews: The parking. To small

Nothing bad to say, but I will address some stuff that others said that I found to be true.
-Someone commented on a chemical smell in the hallway that was probably caused by cleaning supplies. I found this to be true when I first checked in. But I am not sensitive to scents. Also, I never smelled that odor again after Day 1.
-Many people commented on outdated hotel decor. I found the lobby and main floor to be very modern, but yes the room decor was outdated. But that doesn‚Äôt personally bother me. My room had a bed and not one, but two chairs! It had everything that I needed such as a mini fridge, blow dryer and iron + ironing board. The bed was also very comfy.
-Someone said the thermostat didn‚Äôt work. I had 0 issues with the thermostat. But I am a person who is usually cold. So the first thing I do when I check into hotels is turn the thermostat up. I did not use the air conditioning at all during my stay, only heat.
-Many people said that check-out was difficult and there was a long line. I had 0 issues. There was almost never more than 2 people in line any time I went to the front desk. They also have boxes placed throughout the main floor where you can stick your keycard in. No need to go to the front desk and check-out
-Some people stated that the pool was closed. The pool was open during my stay November 29 - December 1, 2022. I used the pool and greatly enjoyed it. The pool is indoors and is heated.
-Many people commented on elevators not working. All of the elevators were working during my stay.
-Some people commented on noise from the bar across the street. Perhaps because I stayed during the weekday and not the weekend, the bar across the street was never even open. I did not hear a lot of noise from the street. I was on the 9th floor.
-I think the only thing that can be improved would be adding in machines where we can refill water containers. They have water fountains by the main floor bathroom and also by the gym.
Positive Reviews:
Superb stay! Absolutely no complaints on my end. I saw so many bad reviews on here and on Google. To the point where I became afraid to stay here but it was already too late to cancel my booking and be refunded. So I went ahead with my booking and I‚Äôm very glad that I did. I had 0 issues with this hotel. I would definitely stay here again and also recommend it to others. I am not the kind of person who eats at hotels. And I have worked at hotels both in the US and UK. But I don‚Äôt travel to eat hotel food. I travel in order to try the local restaurants. So I can not comment on that. But I will try to address all of the other comments that I read. 
-Great location 
-Great price
-Heated indoor pool
-Kind hotel staff

Review Title: Nice hotel, but some small issues
Negative Reviews: The club across the street was BLARING music until midnight.   Every few minutes a loud song would start up. It kept us awake after our long day on the road. Be aware that it doesn't stop until midnight on Sundays and later on other nights. We were in room 330.  Maybe if you were higher up or father back it wouldn't be as loud (?). The lobby is pretty but we noticed there was a bad smell every time we entered .  There was little to no ventilation in the bathroom, so it took a really long time for the mirror to clear after showers.  This made it difficult to apply make up in a timely manner.  The Starbucks was a complete joke. The two employees who were trying to fill in for whoever actually worked there had no idea how to make a hot latte OR an iced cappuccino.  It took 20 minutes for them to make what we asked for and even then it was wrong.  They were nice, but not knowledgeable.  There was not enough creamer in the room for the coffee provided, plus the lids didn't fit the coffee cups.

Review Title: Nice staff.  Seedy area.  Not coming back.
Negative Reviews: Safety / security.  Open amenities (lounges, bars, restaurants, hot tub).  Refresh decor.
Positive Reviews:
We did not pay an extraordinary amount for this room ($130/night + taxes) but we would never stay here again. The location is rough. We were panhandled almost literally inside the valet lobby this morning while waiting for our car (the man came right to the opened sliding door). There are homeless literally on the property and all around the block that the hotel occupies. We walked a block over to a Subway / Waffle House and immediately turned around because of the presence of homeless / loiterers near the restaurant doors.  A seedy liquor store is directly across the street, vacant storefronts are immediately across the street and this feels to be just a generally run down area. Not what I expected for such a name brand chain hotel. 

I fully understand that some of this does not reflect directly in the hotel but rather larger circumstances In all major cities today.  I am sympathetic to those in the situation but I also want to feel safe and secure when in a city 1,000 miles away from home.  I actually feel badly for the hotel because the surroundings are clearly hurting business here.  

The building itself was relatively clean but very "tired" in terms of decor. Could use an overhaul. Most of the amenities were closed, including all of the restaurants.  Breakfast buffet was open for $25 (including tax + tip) per person and some of the food had already run out by the time we came down around 8:30.  Eggs / sausage / bacon / bread options / oatmeal.  Cold coffee.  Limited tea.  There were no spoons for whatever reason.

The room itself was a bit small (one queen bed and shared microwave in hallway near the elevator).  Musty smell throughout.  The air conditioning unit made a loud "ticking" noise all night long. 

The staff is very friendly!!  Everyone greeted us promptly with a smile and / or "hello."  Everyone was very helpful and cordial.

Sadly, we would not stay here again.
Great service

I did not check in my room until 700 pm I kept calling and the receptionist said the room will be ready in an hour i literally had to go down stairs to the check in desk to get checked in they never called about our room and I was late getting to my reservation dinner for my daughter party

Review Title: We would not come back, sorry.
Negative Reviews:
There was a musky smell throughout the hotel. The pictures do not resemble the current property. It is very run down. The parking elevator was broken and the walkway from parking area was dark, underground, and on a curve in the road with only a ribbon between you and the on coming traffic. 

The first night when we returned from our evening out the toilet had backed up and overflowed while we were gone. When we called for housekeeping, we were told no one was available. I asked if we could at least get cleaning supplies. We had to wait 30 minutes and by then it was 12:30am and my husband had to clean it.  The next day they did comp our two nights after we gave our stay a 5 ( pretty generous) on the text messaging  they communicate with their customers on. Someone in management called our room to apologize. That was good. 

Our second night, there were several rooms that we‚Äôre gathering in the hallway to continue their gathering from where ever they came from.  It was a group of young men and they we‚Äôre intoxicated. I utilized the text messaging to ask for assistance. Security came in about twenty minutes. It was about 12:45am by then. Once security left, they came back out in the hallway to continue the party. I utilized the text messaging again. They said security would monitor the hallway for an hour to make sure they did not come back out. Security did not monitor because the group came out again. This went on into 1:45.
